page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT
page.content: 50% of the 92 residents in our{housing survey are in work. 15 housholds(47%) have one resident in work and the same number have more than one. The 1981 {population}census 10% sample noted 7 men working for every 3 woman and {social class}skewed upwards. Our 1985 survey includes the occupations of 61 people and confirms these census findings. Of 33 men, almost all can be classified as Professional / Managerial, though a few occupations are vague. Occuring more than once are Managering Director-4, Farmer-4, Teacher-3, Physicist-2, Engineer-2, Official-2. There are also 3 students and 2 retired. The 28 woman include 5 school girls, 8 in various types of work and 15 houswives, an occupation which seems to have no retiring age. Kingscote is no longer a working community. It is a dormitory village.
